page.title: 19CHANGING TIMES
page.content: The following information was obtained from Mr. George Starkie an old inhabitant of{Newhey.} Up to the inter-war period most of the streets in Newhey were cobbled. Trams ran from Newhey into Rochdale town centre. Mr. Starkie's earliest recollections are when the most common forms of transport were horse-drawn. There has been little change in the number of shops in Newhey since 1923 but in many cases owners and the type of trade carried out have changed. The roads on the estate near Newhey County Primary School were built by German prisoners of war during World War Two.
